document_content.title: Referral for Evaluation of Chronic Fatigue and Joint Pain

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jenkins is being referred for further assessment of persistent fatigue and migratory joint pain of unclear etiology.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports a 6-month history of progressive fatigue, generalized malaise, and intermittent joint pain affecting her wrists, knees, and ankles. She denies recent fever, weight loss, or rash. Over-the-counter analgesics have provided minimal relief. There is no prior history of autoimmune disease.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: Past medical history includes mild asthma, well controlled. No known drug allergies. Surgical history unremarkable.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Albuterol inhaler as needed for asthma symptoms.

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: On examination, vital signs are within normal limits. Mild tenderness of bilateral wrists and knees, no synovitis or swelling noted. No skin changes or lymphadenopathy.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent laboratory tests: CBC and metabolic panel within normal limits; ESR mildly elevated at 28 mm/hr; ANA pending. No radiographs performed to date.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the chronicity of symptoms and lack of clear diagnosis, I am referring Ms. Jenkins for further evaluation and management. Please assess for possible connective tissue disease or other causes of her symptoms.
